p: Human metapneumovirus is a major cause of infection in children worldwide [ 37]. Since it was discovered, several international studies have highlighted how primary infection occurs before 5 years of age and that all children are potentially infected at 10 years of life. Additionally, a number of reinfections may occur in subsequent years [ 2]. To date, we know that this pathogen can be responsible for acute respiratory pictures not only in pediatric patients, but also in elderly and immunosuppressed subjects.
